snippet: The victory by Gov. Scott Walker ensures that Republicans largely retain control of Wisconsin, and Mr. Walker’s fast-rising political profile is likely to soar among conservatives.
abstract: Wisconsin Gov Scott Walker soundly defeats Milwaukee Mayor Tom Barrett to become the first governor in the country to survive a recall election; victory deals a painful blow to Democrats and labor unions, ensures that Republicans will largely retain control of the state, and will likely burnish his fast-rising political profile among conservatives.

byline.original: By MONICA DAVEY and JEFF ZELENY
byline.contributor: Monica Davey reported from Waukesha, and Jeff Zeleny from Washington. Steven Yaccino contributed reporting from Waukesha. Marjorie Connelly, Dalia Sussman and Allison Kopicki contributed research from New York.

lead_paragraph: The victory by Gov. Scott Walker ensures that Republicans largely retain control of Wisconsin, and Mr. Walker’s fast-rising political profile is likely to soar among conservatives.

headline.print_headline: Governor Wins Wisconsin Vote In Recall Drive
headline.sub: G.O.P. Governor’s Win Is Seen as Blow to Labor Unions
